1.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
1.str2: To remind, remember, call to mind. From hupo and mimnesko; to remind quietly, i.e. Suggest to the memory.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
1.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
From a compound of peitho and archo; to be persuaded by a ruler, i.e. to submit to authority; by analogy, to conform to advice.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Ready, prepared. From an old noun heteos; adjusted, i.e. Ready.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

2.str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Peaceable, abstaining from fighting, not contentious. Peaceable.
Gentle, mild, forbearing, fair, reasonable, moderate. From epi and eiko; appropriate, i.e. mild.

2.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Plural
2.str2: To show forth, prove. From en and deiknuo; to indicate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Mildness, gentleness. From praus; mildness, i.e. humility.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

3.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
At one time or other, at some time, formerly. From the base of pou and te; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

3.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
3.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Foolish, thoughtless. By implication, sensual.
Unbelieving, disobedient, who will not be persuaded. Unpersuadable, i.e. Contumacious.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
And, even, also, namely.
From handano; sensual delight; by implication, desire.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: (either trans. or intrans.), I spend time, pass time, live. From dia and ago; to pass time or life.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From kakos; badness, i.e. depravity, or malignity, or trouble.
And, even, also, namely.
Envy, a grudge, spite. Probably akin to the base of phtheiro; ill-will, i.e. Jealousy.
Hateful, detestable, disgusting. From a derivative of an obsolete apparently primary stugo; hated, i.e. Odious.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.

3.parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
3.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

4.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness. From chrestos; usefulness, i.e. Morally, excellence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

4.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
4.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Love of mankind, benevolence. From the same as philanthropos; fondness of mankind, i.e. Benevolence.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: From epi and phaino; to shine upon, i.e. Become visible or known.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
5.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
5.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
5.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pity, mercy, compassion. Of uncertain affinity; compassion.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A bath (of water, not the vessel), water for washing, washing. From louo; a bath, i.e., baptism.
A new birth, regeneration, renewal. From palin and genesis; rebirth, i.e. spiritual renovation; specially, Messianic restoration.
Renewing; a renewal or change of heart and life. From anakainoo; renovation.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

6.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: Or ekchuno ek-khoo'-no from ek and cheo; to pour forth; figuratively, to bestow.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

6.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
6.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Richly, abundantly. Adverb from plousios; copiously.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

6.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
6.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.

7.str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

7.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
7.str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

7.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Plural
7.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From kleros and the base of nomos (reflexively) getting by apportionment); a sharer by lot, i.e. Inheritor; by implication, a possessor.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.

8.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
And, even, also, namely.

8.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
8.str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.

8.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
8.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

8.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
8.str2: To assert emphatically. Middle voice of a compound of dia and bebaioo; to confirm thoroughly, i.e. Asseverate.
This; he, she, it.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

8.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
8.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

8.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
8.str2: To be thoughtful, careful, give heed. From a derivative of phren; to exercise thought, i.e. Be anxious.
From pro and histemi; to stand before, i.e. to preside, or to practise.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
This; he, she, it.

8.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
8.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
And, even, also, namely.
Profitable, beneficial, useful. From a form of ophelos; helpful or serviceable, i.e. Advantageous.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

9.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

9.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
9.str2: From peri and histemi; to stand all around, i.e. to be a bystander, or to keep away from.
Probably from the base of musterion; dull or stupid, i.e. Heedless, blockhead, absurd.
A question, debate, controversy; a seeking, search. From zeteo; a searching, i.e. A dispute or its theme.
Genealogy. From the same as genealogeo; tracing by generations, i.e. 'genealogy'.
Contention, strife, wrangling. Of uncertain affinity; a quarrel, i.e. wrangling.
From machomai; a battle, i.e. controversy.
From nomos; according to law, i.e. Legal; as noun, an expert in the law.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

9.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
9.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Vain, unreal, ineffectual, unproductive; practically: godless. From the base of maten; empty, i.e. profitless, or, an idol.

10.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
10.str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.
Disposed to form sects, sectarian, heretical, factious. From the same as hairetizo; a schismatic.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time. As the compare of duo; second.
A warning, admonition, counsel. From nous and a derivative of tithemi; calling attention to, i.e. mild rebuke or warning.

11.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

11.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
(including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).

11.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: To change for the worse, corrupt, pervert. From ek and strepho; to pervert.

11.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

11.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
11.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(perhaps a new coinage), self-condemned. From autos and a derivative or katakrino; self-condemned.

12.str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

12.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
12.str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
Artemas, a Christian in Rome. Contracted from a compound of Artemis and doron; gift of Artemis; Artemas, a Christian.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From a derivative of tugchano; fortuitous, i.e. Fortunate; Tychicus, a Christian.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

12.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
12.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

12.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
12.str2: To hasten, be eager, be zealous. From spoude; to use speed, i.e. To make effort, be prompt or earnest.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

12.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
12.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Nicopolis, a city of Macedonia. From nikos and polis; victorious city; Nicopolis, a place in Macedonia.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

12.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
12.str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
To pass the winter. From para and cheimazo; to winter near, i.e. Stay with over the rainy season.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.

13.str2: Diligently, earnestly, zealously. Adverb from spoudaios; earnestly, promptly.

13.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
13.str2: To send forward, accompany, equip for a journey. From pro and pempo; to send forward, i.e. Escort or aid in travel.
Zenas, a lawyer in Rome. Probably contracted from a poetic form of Zeus and doron; Jove-given; Zenas, a Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From nomos; according to law, i.e. Legal; as noun, an expert in the law.
Apollos, a Jew of Alexandria. Probably from the same as Apollonia; Apollos, an Israelite.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

13.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
13.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

13.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
13.str2: A primary verb; to leave, i.e. to fail or be absent.

14.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

14.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 1st Person Plural
14.str2: Our, our own. From thnetos; our.

14.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
14.str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
From pro and histemi; to stand before, i.e. to preside, or to practise.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Necessary, essential, intimate, right, proper. From anagke; necessary; by implication, close.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

14.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
14.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

15.str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
15.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

15.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
15.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.

15.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
15.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

15.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
15.str2: From philos; to be a friend to (an individual or an object), i.e. Have affection for; specially, to kiss.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
15.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

15.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
